modules.events.Event module¶

class modules.events.Event.Event(event_name: str, queue: EventQueue, event_time: int | None = None)¶

Bases: ABC

An event that has a name, time, and priority.

name¶

The name of the event.

Type:

str

queue¶

The event queue to which this event belongs.

Type:

EventQueue

time¶

The time at which the event occurs.

Type:

float

priority¶

The priority of the event for sorting in the queue.

Type:

int

REFERENCE_PRIORITY: float = 0.0¶
_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>¶
_set_time(event_time: int | None) → None¶

Internal method to set the time of the event, used to avoid code duplication.

Parameters:

event_time (int, optional) – New time for the event.

add_to_queue()¶

Adds this event to its associated event queue.

Gets the priority of the event.

modules.events.Placement module¶

class modules.events.Placement.Placement(event_name: str, queue: EventQueue, app: Application, device_id: int, event_time: int | None = None)¶

Bases: Event

FIFTEEN_MINUTES_BACKOFF = 900000¶

_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>¶
_calculate_priority(app: Application) → float¶

Calculate the priority of the Placement event based on the application’s priority.

Parameters:

app (Application) – The application to place.

Returns:

Calculated priority.

Return type:

float

deployable_proc(proc, device)¶

Checks if a given process can be deployed onto a device.

Parameters:

  • proc – Processus

  • device – Device

Returns:

Boolean, True if deployable, else False

linkability(env, deployed_app_list, proc_links)¶

Checks if a newly deployed processus can be linked to already deployed processus in a given app by checking the link quality on all Paths between the newly deployed processus and already deployed ones.

Parameters:

  • env – Environment

  • deployed_app_list – list of devices on which deployment is proposed

  • proc_links – Application.proc_links, len(Application.num_procs)*len(Application.num_procs) matrix indicating necessary bandwidth on each virtual link between application processus members

Returns:

Boolean, True if all the interconnexions are possible with given bandwidths, False if at least one is impossible.

process(env: Environment)¶

Tries to place a multi-processus application from a given device.

Really messy, code to clean

Parameters:

env – Environment

Returns:

Deployment times and deployed onto devices (Device ID List)

Return type:

Tuple[List[int], List[int]]

reservable_bandwidth(env: Environment, path: Path, bandwidth_needed)¶

Checks if a given bandwidth can be reserved along a given path.

Parameters:

  • env – Environment

  • path – Path

  • bandwidth_needed – Bandwidth to allocate on the Path

Returns:

Boolean, True if bandwidth can be reserved, else False
